label: 大臣
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: the senior minister in the Yamato king's court by the sixth century, if not earlier. Omi 臣 was the kabane bestowed on families claiming descent from previous Yamato kings. Typically, one or two counselors of omi status advised Yamato kings, and their daughters also served as royal consorts. By the later sixth century one of those counselors was designated supreme omi" and served as the senior royal counselor."
